intro: Dracocephalum intermedium, commonly known as blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the mint family, Lamiaceae, and is characterized by its striking blue to purple flower clusters. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture, while its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. Dracocephalum intermedium is valued for its ornamental appeal and is also used in traditional herbal medicine.
